funfact1: The longest place name in the world is Taumatawhakatangihangakoauauotamateaturipukakapikimaungahoronukupokaiwhenuakitanatahu, a hill in New Zealand.
funfact10: Bananas are berries according to botanical definitions, but strawberries are not.
funfact11: Dinosaurs lived on every continent, including Antarctica.
funfact12: The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer due to the expansion of the iron on hot days.
funfact13: Koalas have fingerprints that are so similar to humans that they could tangle with crime scene investigations.
funfact14: The largest known star, UY Scuti, is so big that if placed at the center of our solar system, its surface would extend beyond the orbit of Saturn.
funfact15: Pineapples take about two years to grow.
funfact16: Some turtles can breathe through their rear ends.
funfact17: Peanuts are not nuts, they're legumes.
funfact18: There are more ways to shuffle a deck of cards than there are atoms on Earth.
funfact19: Venus is the only planet in our solar system that rotates clockwise.
funfact2: The heart of a blue whale is so large that a human could swim through its arteries.
funfact20: The shortest sentence in the English language that contains every letter is 'How vexingly quick daft zebras jump!'
funfact21: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus because of its slow rotation and orbit speed.
funfact23: There are more libraries in the US than McDonald's.
funfact24: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
funfact25: All the ants on Earth weigh about the same as all the humans.
funfact27: Cats have more bones in their bodies than humans.
funfact29: Humans share 50% of their DNA with bananas.
funfact30: France was still executing people by guillotine when the first Star Wars movie came out.
funfact31: The Nile crocodile can hold its breath for up to 2 hours while waiting for prey.
funfact32: Penguins have glands under their eyes to extract salt from the seawater they ingest.
funfact33: Some lizards can shoot blood out of their eyes to deter predators.
funfact34: The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds.
funfact35: Snails can sleep for up to three years.
funfact36: Polar bears have black skin underneath their white fur to better absorb the sun's rays.
funfact37: The Andromeda Galaxy is on a collision course with the Milky Way, but it won't happen for about 4 billion years.
funfact38: Cows have best friends and can experience stress when they are separated.
funfact39: The mantis shrimp can throw a punch at 50 mph, accelerating quicker than a .22-caliber bullet.
funfact4: The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes.
funfact40: Baby elephants suck their trunks for comfort, much like human babies suck their thumbs.
funfact41: The sun makes up over 99% of the solar system's mass.
funfact42: A nanosecond is to one second as one second is to approximately 31.71 years.
funfact43: The tongue is the strongest muscle in the human body.
funfact44: The world's smallest mammal is the bumblebee bat of Thailand, weighing less than a penny.
funfact45: Pythagoras, the ancient Greek mathematician, had a phobia of beans.
funfact46: Sloths take two weeks to digest their food.
funfact47: The Earth's core is about as hot as the surface of the sun.
funfact48: Reindeer eyeballs turn blue in winter to help them see at lower light levels.
funfact49: Hippo milk is pink due to the presence of two unique skin secretions.
funfact5: Jupiter is so large that over 1,300 Earths could fit inside of it.
funfact50: Shakespeare invented the name 'Jessica' for his play Merchant of Venice.
funfact51: The Twitter bird's official name is Larry, named after basketball legend Larry Bird.
funfact52: The first oranges weren't orange; the original oranges from Southeast Asia were a tangerine-pomelo hybrid, and they were green.
funfact53: Some birds can recognize themselves in a mirror.
funfact54: Sharks have been around longer than trees.
funfact55: The oldest known recipe is for beer.
funfact56: Penguins propose to their mates with a pebble.
funfact57: The total length of all the DNA in your body's cells laid end to end would be about twice the diameter of the Solar System.
funfact58: The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss in 'If I Ran the Zoo.'
funfact59: The popsicle was invented by an 11-year-old in 1905.
funfact6: The world's largest desert is Antarctica, not the Sahara, as deserts are defined by dryness, not heat.
funfact60: Cheetahs can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph faster than a Ferrari.
funfact61: There's a volcano in Indonesia that spews blue lava.
funfact62: The Great Wall of China is not visible from space, contrary to popular belief.
funfact63: It rains diamonds on Jupiter and Saturn, due to the atmospheric pressure.
funfact64: The fear of vegetables is called Lachanophobia.
funfact65: Frogs can freeze without dying, their heart and brain stop, and thaw out in spring and keep living.
funfact66: Almonds are members of the peach family.
funfact67: Every 'c' in Pacific Ocean pronounces differently.
funfact68: The Mona Lisa has no eyebrows.
funfact69: The oldest 'Yo Mama' joke was discovered on a 3,500 year old Babylonian tablet.
funfact7: Honey never spoils; archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3000 years old.
funfact70: Elephants are the only animal that can't jump.
funfact71: In the Caribbean there are oysters that can climb trees.
funfact72: If you took out all the empty space in our atoms, the human race could fit in the volume of a sugar cube.
funfact73: The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.
funfact74: There's a basketball court above the supreme court, it's known as the highest court in the land.
funfact75: Avocado has highest protein content of all fruit.
funfact76: The human brain operates on about 15 watts.
funfact77: The only letter that doesn’t appear on the periodic table is J.
funfact78: A Rubik's cube has 43,252,003,274,489,856,000 possible configurations.
funfact79: Squirrels plant thousands of new trees each year simply by forgetting where they put their acorns.
funfact8: In ancient Rome, uncooked pasta was originally a fast food eaten by hand.
funfact80: There is enough DNA in an average person’s body to stretch from the sun to Pluto and back — 17 times.
